result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joshua A. Geishert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete a 24- or 26-week domestic abuse education class.

Submit to AODA and follow through with all recommendations.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

5 days credit in the event of revocation.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Joshua A. Geishert in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Matter was on the calendar for prelim but counsel inform the Court that the parties are prepared to resolve this today for DPA on the felony and probation on the battery with conditions of d.a., costs, and any programming required by the agent.  Def pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Court approves DPA on count 1.  Count 2 - sentence withheld for 2 years probation with conditions of d.a., AODA/follow through; costs.  5 days credit in the event of revocation.  Count 3 dismissed/read-in.

Defendant Joshua A. Geishert in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defense waives formal reading of the complaint. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Defense requests prelim scheduling and will waive the time limits. Victim addresses the Court re. no contact provision. Court denies request for amendment to no contact provision.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Joshua A. Geishert in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA states this is ADA Forehand's case. Complaint was filed this morning. Atty. M states defense hasn't received copy yet. Court asks Atty. M thoughts on prelim. Atty. M asks that initial be adjourned; wants to be heard on bail re the no contact condition. Subject of the no contact condition addresses the Court; asks for no contact to be lifted. Court denies the request.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 11:00 am.
